channel.title: Magic attack needing runes

item.title: Magic attack needing runes
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

Spell ID is magic on player. Magic ID is magic on npc, you have most likely changed the spell id and testing things on npcs, also like I’ve stated, you’re using two different kinds of brackets and are using an incorrect format.

sigh I give up on you. Just hate me … it won’t help yeah though.

Read full topic

item.title: Magic attack needing runes
item.dc:creator: @crakaman crakaman
item.description:
@crakaman wrote:

Actually did I ever say it was my forum? and two it is my thread if it was yours than you would be able to ask a question on here wouldnt you? I created this “thread” and another one I bring shame to 15 year olds? yea maybe because Ive got a life? Now please stop posting on here. and actually I took what you said as a insult not as a helpfull hint because you never said if it was bad or correct? now did you? nope [br][size=1]Posted on: July 05, 2007, 07:53:15 PM[/size][hr][quote=“zoltanman, post:12, topic:119791”][quote author=Fir3 Flam3 link=topic=169215.msg1569504#msg1569504 date=1183597662]
In your client.java, find this:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return true; }

Then replace it with this:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return false; }

Credits: Azn Ix

That fixed mine, so it should help yours.
[/quote]

Crakaman, do this, obviously you didn’t even read this guy’s post.[/quote]

yes i already did that

Read full topic

ROFL. LMFAO. Spam? Are you out of your mind? It was a helpful post stating you were using two different kinds of brackets, and the question mark stand there because I don’t know what you’re up to. I see more mistakes than your age. Pfft you bring shame to us 15 year olds =[.

Learn to respect others if you want any in return. This isn’t your forum so you can’t tell me to get off your thread, if you’re really irritated by my postings than hit that “X” button over there located in top right of your window and never come back, or don’t bother posting next time.

item.title: Magic attack needing runes
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

You see how you have no spaces between the true and false and == signs?

else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true)

Make it look like this:

else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2) == true)

Just a guess, idk lol, because everything else looks correct.

item.dc:creator: @Fir3_Flam3 Fir3 Flam3
item.description:
@Fir3_Flam3 wrote:

In your client.java, find this:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return true; }

Then replace it with this:

public boolean playerHasItemAmount(int itemID, int itemAmount) { //if(itemID == 0 || itemAmount == 0) return true; playerItemAmountCount = 0; for (int i=0; i<playerItems.length; i++) { if (playerItems[i] == itemID+1) { playerItemAmountCount = playerItemsN[i]; } if(playerItemAmountCount >= itemAmount){ return true;} } //return (itemAmount <= playerItemAmountCount); return false; }

Credits: Azn Ix

That fixed mine, so it should help yours.

item.title: Magic attack needing runes
item.dc:creator: @crakaman crakaman
item.description:
@crakaman wrote:

Hey guys I have a question the question is how do I make it so my magic attack needs runes for monsters it works for players but not on monsters… Ive tried a couple things and this is what i have now

[code][if(spellID == 12975) // smoke barrage (lvl 86 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 95)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(554, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(556, 4)==false))
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(554, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(556, 4)==true))
{
startAnimation(1979);
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(30);
castOnPlayer.PoisonPlayer();
castOnPlayer.inCombat();
inCombat();
PkingDelay = 10;
stillgfx(391, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.stillgfx(391, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
sendMessage(“You poison the enemy.”);
deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 1);
deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 1);
deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(554), 1);
deleteItem(556, getItemSlot(556), 1);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 95)
{
sendMessage(“You need a magic level of 96 to cast this spell.”);
}
}

if(spellID == 12881) // ice burst (lvl 70 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 74)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(562, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 4)==false))
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(562, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 4)==true))
{
startAnimation(1978);
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(15);
castOnPlayer.entangle();
castOnPlayer.inCombat();
inCombat();
PkingDelay = 15;
stillgfx(363, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.stillgfx(363, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.sendMessage(“You have been frozen!”);
sendMessage(“You freeze the enemy!”);
deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 1);
deleteItem(565, getItemSlot(562), 1);
deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(555), 1);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
castOnPlayer.currentHealth -= castOnPlayer.hitDiff;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 74)
{
sendMessage(“You need a magic level of 75 to cast this spell.”);
}
}

if(spellID == 12891) // ice barrage (lvl 94 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] > 94)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==false))
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 6)==true))
{
startAnimation(1979);
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(34);
castOnPlayer.entangle();
castOnPlayer.inCombat();
castOnPlayer.stayStill();
inCombat();
PkingDelay = 15;
stillgfx(369, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.stillgfx(369, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.sendMessage(“You have been frozen!”);
sendMessage(“freeze the enemy!”);
deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 0);
deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 0);
deleteItem(554, getItemSlot(555), 0);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 124)
{
sendMessage(“You need a magic level of 125 to cast this spell.”);
}
}

if(spellID == 12929) // blood barrage (lvl 92 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 114)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(566, 1)==false))
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(566, 1)==true))
{
{startAnimation(1979);
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(30);
NewHP += hitDiff;
if(NewHP > getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) {
NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
}
updateRequired = true;
castOnPlayer.inCombat();
inCombat();

stillgfx(377, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.stillgfx(377, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.sendMessage(“Your life has been drained!”);

deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 0);
deleteItem(566, getItemSlot(566), 0);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 114)
{
sendMessage(“You need a magic level of 115 to cast this spell.”);
}
}

if(spellID == 13023) // shadow barrage (lvl 88 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 104)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(556, 4)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(566, 3)==false))
{
sendMessage(“You do not have enough runes to cast this spell.”);
}
else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(556, 4)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(566, 3)==true))
{

hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(30);
heal = 10;
playerLevel[3] += heal;
updateRequired = true;

PkingDelay = 25;
stillgfx(383, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.stillgfx(383, castOnPlayer.absY, castOnPlayer.absX);
castOnPlayer.sendMessage(“You get covered by shadow”);
sendMessage(“You cover your enemy with shadow”);
deleteItem(560, getItemSlot(560), 4);
deleteItem(4278, getItemSlot(4278), 2);
deleteItem(556, getItemSlot(556), 4);
deleteItem(566, getItemSlot(566), 3);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 104)
{
sendMessage(“You need a magic level of 105 to cast this spell.”);
}
}

if(spellID == 12871) // ice blitz (lvl 82 spell)
{
if(playerLevel[6] >= 89)
{
if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==false) || (playerHasItemAmount(555, 3)==false))

else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(555, 3)==true))

}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 89)
{

}

if(spellID == 12911) // blood blitz (lvl 80 spell)

else if((playerHasItemAmount(560, 2)==true) && (playerHasItemAmount(4278, 2)==true))
